org.openbel.framework.common.record
Class RecordFile

java.lang.Object
  org.openbel.framework.common.record.RecordFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<byte[]>
Direct Known Subclasses:
NamespaceRecordFile
public class RecordFile
extends Object
implements Iterable<byte[]>

Record files are a representation of files that contain fixed-length records. As such, the size of these files are multiples of their associated record size. The first record of every record file contains metadata indicating the record size.

It is helpful to consider the contents of these objects in a tabular manner. 

 row number: column one, column two, [...], column n
An example of a record file's contents containing two columns, each with a size of 8 bytes. 
 0: 0xffffffff 0xffffffff
 1: 0xffffffff 0xffffffff

When a record file is created with a existing file, the size of the last column will be set at runtime by reading the metadata. Record files are not thread-safe.

Author:
Nick Bargnesi

Constructor Detail

RecordFile

public RecordFile(File path,
                  RecordMode mode,
                  Column<?>... columns)
Creates a record file associated with the supplied path and columns.

Parameters:
path - Path; may not be null. If the path does not exist it will be created.
mode - RecordMode; read-only or read/write
columns - Columns composing each record; may not be null or have zero length
Throws:
InvalidArgument - Thrown if path or columns is null or invalid

writeMetadata

@Deprecated
public void writeMetadata(byte[] bytes)
                   throws IOException
Deprecated. Explicitly writing the metadata record can cause inconsistent record files if used incorrectly. Metadata for the record file should only be written on construction.

Writes metadata to this record file overwriting existing metadata.

Parameters:
bytes - The metadata bytes to write
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurs during I/O seeks or writes
InvalidArgument - Thrown if a write of anything other than the size of the record is requested
UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if the mode is set to read-only
See Also:
RecordFile(File, RecordMode, Column...)
